hours_text:
## Overview

### Hours

#### Galleries

  * Sunday: Closed 
  * Monday: Closed 
  * Tuesday: Closed 
  * Wednesday: Closed 
  * Thursday: Closed 
  * Friday: Closed 
  * Saturday: Closed 

#### Visitor Desk

  * Sunday: 10AM–5PM 
  * Monday: Closed 
  * Tuesday: 8:30AM–6PM 
  * Wednesday: 8:30AM–6PM 
  * Thursday: 8:30AM–9PM 
  * Friday: 8:30AM–6PM 
  * Saturday: 10AM–6PM 

#### Café

  * Sunday: Closed 
  * Monday: Closed 
  * Tuesday: 8AM–4PM 
  * Wednesday: 8AM–4PM 
  * Thursday: 8AM–4PM 
  * Friday: 8AM–4PM 
  * Saturday: Closed 

#### Store

  * Sunday: 10AM–4PM 
  * Monday: Closed 
  * Tuesday: 10AM–4PM 
  * Wednesday: 10AM–4PM 
  * Thursday: 10AM–4PM 
  * Friday: 10AM–4PM 
  * Saturday: 10AM–4PM 

* * *

###  Special hours 

The Wexner Center is closed on the following holidays: New Year’s Eve, New Year’s Day, Martin Luther King Jr. Day, Memorial Day, Juneteenth, Independence Day, Labor Day, Veterans Day, Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve, and Christmas Day. 

The center is also closed December 22 through January 2 for Ohio State's academic winter recess.

* * *

###  Ticket Sales 

Tickets for most Wexner Center events are on sale at [_wexarts.org_](https://wexarts.org) , the Visitor Desk on the entrance level of the Wexner Center, and the North High Street entrance of Mershon Auditorium.

When purchasing tickets online, you can print them at home or hold them at the box office. If your event is in the Wexner Center, you can collect will call tickets at the Visitor Desk dur...
admission_text:
#  Visitor Policy

As a multidisciplinary center for contemporary art and culture, the Wexner Center for the Arts has a variety of programs and multiple event spaces, with exhibitions, performances, film screenings, educational programs, and more. Our visitor guidelines vary by program and event space. Please review them below to help you plan your visit. We look forward to seeing you!

* * *

###  Health and safety 

For your safety, all Wexner Center Security Services staff are CPR and AED certified.

Masks are optional during your visit and can be acquired at the front desk, if desired. This guideline may vary on an event-by-event basis and will be noted on the event page and in the pre-event email.

* * *

###  Personal belongings 

We recommend keeping anything you consider valuable at home, as we are not responsible for lost or stolen items. Coat check is available for items you may not bring into the event space.

#### What to leave at home (for all event spaces)

  * Umbrellas
  * Professional cameras, recording equipment (audio or visual), selfie sticks, iPads, and other devices that interfere with other guests’ views
  * Sharp items such as knives, box cutters, and scissors
  * Weapons of any kind. In accordance with Ohio law, possession of concealed handguns is not permitted on university property, including the Wexner Center.
  * Aerosols including pepper spray or Mace
  * Flammable liquids
  * Other dangerous or offensive items, including glass, cans, fireworks, ...
